sense.name: fulfill a function, perform a duty, be used as
sense.commentary: NP1[+instrument] SERVE NP2/COMP([+result])/ADVP[+goal] NP1[+agent] SERVE PP/NP[+target] NP is +agent Includes VPC serve_well
sense.examples: This table serves both as a desk and a work bench. That law serves no useful purpose that I can determine. That sewage plant serves the entire coastal community. This example will serve to illustrate the point. He argues that the state-run programs are not serving the public as planned. His remarks served to ignite whole neighborhoods. Bold decisions by their visionary CEO have served the firm well over the past decade. A shot of whiskey served to calm their nerves. Advocates believe the tax cuts will serve to boost economic growth. He served in Congress for two terms. They served their country nobly. The waiter will not serve patrons with no shoes or shirts. John wants to serve in the National Guard. They served in Desert Storm.

sense.name: dish out, hand out something, often food
sense.commentary: NP[+agent] SERVE NP[+object] Includes VPC serve_up
sense.examples: They are serving mint juleps on the veranda. Her club serves meals to the homeless on Thursdays. Bob was served a summons to appear in court. The sheriff served him papers at his home. They served up some lively entertainment at the Caberet last night.

sense.name: spend time in prison
sense.examples: He served twenty years in prison for armed robbery. The prisoners were released before they had served their full terms.

sense.name: mate with, sexual reproduction
sense.examples: This pedigree stallion served three brood mares.

sense.name: put a ball into play
sense.examples: It was Mary's turn to serve. He served four aces during the first game of the tournament. That tennis star has been serving erratically lately.

sense.name: wind protectively with yarn or wire
sense.examples: She served the forestays with heavy yarn.
